qas.question: What treaty was used by Stockton and Kearny on January 1, 1847?
What was established after negotiations over San Diego between the Mexcians and Americans?
Which war played a role in ceding San Diego to the United States?
What was the name of the treaty developed between Mexico and the United States in 1848?
Why was the border between Mexico and the United States established one league south of San Diego Bay's most southern tip?

answers.text: to include the entire bay within the United States

qas.question: What treaty was used by Stockton and Kearny on January 1, 1874?
What was established after negotiations over San Francisco between the Mexcians and Americans?
Which war played a role in ceding San Francisco to the United States?
What was the name of the treaty developed between Mexico and the United States in 1884?

plausible_answers.text: to include the entire bay within the United States

qas.question: Why was the border between Mexico and the United States established one league south of San Diego Bay's most northern tip?

context: Stockton and Kearny went on to recover Los Angeles and force the capitulation of Alta California with the "<a0_0><b5_0>Treaty of Cahuenga<b5_0/><a0_0/>" on January 13, 1847. As a result of the <a2_0><b7_0>Mexican–American War of 1846–48<b7_0/><a2_0/>, the territory of Alta California, including San Diego, was ceded to the United States by Mexico, under the terms of the <a3_0><b8_0>Treaty of Guadalupe Hidalgo<b8_0/><a3_0/> in 1848. The Mexican negotiators of that treaty tried to retain San Diego as part of Mexico, but the Americans insisted that San Diego was "for every commercial purpose of nearly equal importance to us with that of San Francisco," and the <a1_0><b6_0>Mexican-American border<b6_0/><a1_0/> was eventually established to be one league south of the southernmost point of San Diego Bay, so as <a4_0><b9_0>to include the entire bay within the United States<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
